title: API filter option for documentation section

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-feature-request
labels.description: Category: A feature request, i.e: not implemented / a PR.

body:
There sometimes happens to be ample amount of APIs present for a given module, 
of which few or many are nightly ones and often times are not very convenient to refer, 
therefore having some kind of filter present under the documentation page makes the job of referring it more developer friendly 
```rust
 ==Stable==

 fn api1()
 fn api2()

 ==unsafe==

 unsafe fn api6()
 unsafe fn api5()

 ==Nightly==

 fn n-api1()
 fn n-api2()
```
because now we can directly distinguish between which ones are nightly dependent from the side section 
also it would be great if we can also implement it for unsafe APIs 

There is one reference issue [here](https://github.com/rust-lang/docs.rs/issues/2115) under docs.rs regarding this one, where we discussed it earlier for some additional context.
